channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Streatham attack: Officer 'feared for his life' in terrorist pursuit
item.description: A police officer describes "locking eyes" with a knife-wielding terrorist before shooting him dead.

item.title: David Gomoh stabbing: Gang guilty of murdering NHS worker
item.description: David Gomoh managed to stagger back home before dying in front of his family.

item.title: Disability campaigner stranded after hotel shower fall
item.description: Jennie Berry was stuck on her bathroom floor for 20 minutes after the shower seat broke.

item.title: Essex baby given £1.79m drug for spinal muscular atrophy
item.description: Eleven-month-old Edward has received the world's most expensive drug after a campaign by his parents.

item.title: Bilsdale transmitter fire: TV and radio for 1m off air indefinitely
item.description: The operators of a transmitter which serves part of northern England cannot say when it will be fixed.

item.title: Janos Sztoska: Modern slavery boss made victim live in squalor
item.description: One victim told police he was forced to sleep without a bed and was not allowed to use the toilet.

item.title: Charles and Diana's wedding cake slice sells for £1,850
item.description: The 40-year-old slice of wedding cake was bought by a buyer from Leeds.

item.title: Bradford taxi driver killing: Man guilty of road rage revenge murder
item.description: Ricardo Linton shot dead Mohammed Basharat in Bradford in 2001 in revenge for a road rage incident.

item.title: Megan Newborough death: Man in court charged with murder
item.description: Megan Newborough, 23, was found dead on a rural lane after being reported missing, police say.

item.title: Operation Brock: Brexit lorry controls 'could stay'
item.description: Lorry controls brought in for Brexit could stay - in case of any type of disruption near the border.

item.title: Carlton Colville: Driver seriously injured in conservatory crash
item.description: Derek Harrington says he "thought it was thunder" when the vehicle struck his house.

item.title: Bristol Balloon Fiesta: City's largest multi-site launch
item.description: Around 40 hot air balloons launch from five locations across Bristol as part of Fiesta Fortnight.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Galal Yafai returns to UK from Tokyo
item.description: Galal Yafai was met with cheers and chanting as he arrived at London Heathrow Airport from Tokyo.

item.title: Alex Reid death: Mother completes 624-mile run for heart screening charity
item.description: Heather Reid completes mammoth run in honour of daughter who died from undetected heart condition.

item.title: Birmingham riots: Tariq Jahan reflects 10 years on
item.description: Tariq Jahan says he forgives the men who killed his son during the 2011 riots in Birmingham.

item.title: ‘Parkinson’s doesn't stop me playing tennis’
item.description: Andy Wright, who was diagnosed at 33, says his return to the sport helps alleviate symptoms.

item.title: 'Walking to space was the best day of my life'
item.description: Tim, aged nine, walked 62 miles - the distance between Earth's atmosphere and the boundary of space.

item.title: Channel migrants: Asylum seeker cleared of people smuggling was 'scapegoat'
item.description: Fouad Kakaei's lawyer says asylum seekers are "easy targets" to prosecute for small boat crossings.

item.title: Ellesmere Port crash: Speeding driver jailed for killing friend
item.description: Kelvin Davies admits causing the death of Kieran Lloyd, 18, who was a passenger in his car.

item.title: Teenage boy dies nine days after park attack
item.description: The victim was attacked inside Lordship Recreation Ground and died nine days later.

item.title: M1: Two children die in crash near junction 14
item.description: A woman is arrested on suspicion of driving when above the prescribed limit of alcohol.

item.title: Staffordshire Covid sceptic urges people to get vaccine
item.description: Royal Stoke University Hospital says it is seeing more younger, unvaccinated patients.

item.title: England cricket: James Anderson doubtful for India test with Stuart Broad ruled out
item.description: Stuart Broad will miss England's second Test against India, which starts on Thursday, with James Anderson a doubt.

item.title: Derby County: Wayne Rooney hails 'proudest moment' after Carabao Cup win over Salford City
item.description: Wayne Rooney hails Derby's EFL Cup win over Salford as his 'proudest moment' since becoming Rams boss.

item.title: The Hundred: London Spirit beat Manchester Originals by six runs in thriller
item.description: London Spirit win their first match in the men's Hundred by beating Manchester Originals at Old Trafford.

item.title: Adam Peaty: Olympic swimming champion keen for TV show Superstars return
item.description: Britain's Adam Peaty backs a return of TV show Superstars to see who is the best of the best among Olympic champions from Tokyo.
